com.mousebird.maply

Class BaseInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.BaseInfo
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BillboardInfo, GeometryInfo, LabelInfo, LoftedPolyInfo, MarkerInfo, ShapeInfo, StickerInfo, VectorInfo, WideVectorInfo

    public class BaseInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the base class for all the various Info objects.

    • Field Summary

      boolean disposeAfterUse

    • Field Detail

      • disposeAfterUse

        public boolean disposeAfterUse
        If set, the toolkit will dispose of the objects that were added after it's finished. This saves memory by removing the C++ data for things like VectorObjects.

      • nativeHandle

        protected long nativeHandle

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseInfo

        protected BaseInfo()

    • Method Detail

      • setVisibleHeightRange

        public void setVisibleHeightRange(double minVis,
                                  double maxVis)
        Set the minimum/maximum cutoff for visibility of the feature. This is the closest height the feature will be visible from. Defaults to 0.0 (always visible).

      • setMinVis

        public void setMinVis(double minVis)
        Set the minimum height visibility for a feature.

      • setMaxVis

        public void setMaxVis(double maxVis)
        Set the maximum height visibility for a feature.

      • getVisibleHeightMin

        public double getVisibleHeightMin()
        Returns the minimum cutoff for visibility of the feature. This is the closest height the feature will be visible from. Defaults to 0.0 (always visible).

      • getVisibleHeightMax

        public double getVisibleHeightMax()
        Returns the minimum cutoff for visibility of the feature. This is the largest height the feature will be visible from. Defaults to 0.0 (always visible).

      • setViewDistRange

        public void setViewDistRange(double minViewerDist,
                             double maxViewerDist)
        If set, the objects created will only be visible when in this range of distance from the viewer.

      • getViewDistRangeMin

        public double getViewDistRangeMin()
        Returns:
        Minimim distance from the user that an object will be visible.

      • getViewDistRangeMax

        public double getViewDistRangeMax()
        Returns:
        Maximum distance form the user that an object will be visible.

      • setViewerCenter

        public void setViewerCenter(Point3d center)
        If the viewer center is defined, all the geometry is centered around it. This is convenient with geometry that's relatively small in a larger area.

      • getViewerCenter

        public Point3d getViewerCenter()
        Returns:
        The current viewer center, if there is one.

      • setDrawOffset

        public void setDrawOffset(float drawOffset)
        Set the drawOffset for geometry. This is rarely used.

      • getDrawOffset

        public double getDrawOffset()
        Returns:
        The Z offset for geometry. Rarely used anymore.

      • setDrawPriority

        public void setDrawPriority(int drawPriority)
        Set the drawPriority for the geometry. Draw priority controls the order in which features are drawn.

      • getDrawPriority

        public int getDrawPriority()
        Get the drawPriority for the geometry. Draw priority controls the order in which features are drawn.

      • setEnable

        public void setEnable(boolean newEnable)
        Controls whether or not the geometry will be visible. By default this is true.
        Parameters:
        newEnable - New value for the enable.

      • getEnable

        public boolean getEnable()
        Returns:
        Current enable value.

      • setFade

        public void setFade(float fade)
        The amount of time (in seconds) it takes for new geometry to fade in and fade out. By default, fade is off.

      • setFadeInOut

        public void setFadeInOut(double fadeIn,
                         double fadeOut)
        Geometry can be made to fade in when it appears and fade out when it's removed. These values can be set separately.
        Parameters:
        fadeIn - Time to fade new geometry in.
        fadeOut - Time to fade geometry out when removed.

      • getFadeIn

        public float getFadeIn()
        The amount of time (in seconds) it takes for new geometry to fade in. By default, fade is off.

      • getFadeOut

        public float getFadeOut()
        The amount of time (in seconds) it takes for geometry to fade out when removed. By default, fade is off.

      • setFadeOutTime

        public void setFadeOutTime(double fadeOutTime)
        Geometry can be set to start fading out at a specific time.
        Parameters:
        fadeOutTime - Time to start fading geometry out in seconds from the beginning epoch.

      • getFadeOutTime

        public double getFadeOutTime()
        Returns:
        Time when geometry is set to fade out (if set)

      • setEnableTimes

        public void setEnableTimes(double startEnable,
                           double endEnable)
        Geometry can be enabled over a specific time period. If these are set, the engine will turn the geometry off outside of this range.
        Parameters:
        startEnable - When to start drawing the geometry. Seconds from the beginning epoch.
        endEnable - When to stop drawing the geometry. Seconds from the beginning epoch.

      • setShader

        public void setShader(Shader shader)
        Set the shader to be used in rendering the given objects.

      • setShaderID

        public void setShaderID(long shaderID)
        Set the shader to be used in rendering, by ID

      • getShaderID

        public long getShaderID()
        Return the unique ID for the shader or 0 if there is none.

      • setZBufferRead

        public void setZBufferRead(boolean newVal)
        If set, the renderer will compare this geometry to the z buffer when rendering. Off by default. Most things use priority rendering.

      • setZBufferWrite

        public void setZBufferWrite(boolean newVal)
        If set, the geometry will write to the Z buffer when it renders. On by default

      • setRenderTarget

        public void setRenderTarget(RenderTarget target)
        By default, all geometry renders to the main screen. If set, you can direct that geometry to a specific offscreen render target instead.
